Guard_004.synopsis: Dialog with a prison guard in Wyrm Rock Fortress. Female human.

TalkingSkull_AD.synopsis: AD that Enchanted Bookcase in Wyrm Rock Prison plays while the player is inside.

Guard_002.synopsis: Dialog with a prison guard in Wyrm Rock Fortress. Alfon is a male dwarf. Gruff, a man of few words.

AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor.synopsis: You convinced the entrance guard in Wyrm Rock Prison to open the entrance door for you. This is the AD she says after she approached the door to unlock it.1. If the door is destroyed she is VERY confused, and comments on how it got destroyed during her shift.2. If the door is locked she unlocks it and welcomes you in3. If the door is unlocked she is confused by that.
AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor.how_to_trigger: goto 51; 12; -746click on the sleeping guard to start a dialogIntimidate her to let you inwait for her to approach the door and play the ADif you want to see the confused node: unlock the door before talking to the guard.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress.synopsis: Florrick's dialog when she is following you or waiting for you after you told her to wait.
FlorrickEscapeInProgress.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_Agoto 47; 8; -696oe wyr_florrick_unlockTalk with Florrick. Make her join you.Click on her again.

Florrick.synopsis: Dialog with the Councillor Florrick in Wyrm Rock Prison.You can release Florrick. If you do so, she'll ask you to help her escape. First, you need to open the prison cell. You can find the key to the cell in the inventory of one of the guards.Second, you need to help Florrick escape the prison.There are two ways of doing so:1) Killing all guards in Prison, Flaming Fist Office and one of the bridges.2) Finding a secret tunnel in the janitor's closet.
Florrick.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_Agoto 47; 8; -696Find a prison cell with Florrick.Talk with Florick.

Guard_003.synopsis: Dialog with a prison guard in Wyrm Rock Fortress. Male human patrolling the prison. All about duty and honour.
Guard_003.how_to_trigger: Click on |Prison Guard 003| - S_WYR_WyrmRockPrison_Guard_003 - cbf95410-351a-491e-92aa-1663df98c6f5 - (60 10 -731) (he is patrolling the prison)

AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer.synopsis: Florrick is whispering to herself, in despair, while imprisoned in Wyrm's Rock Prison. She's thinking about the loss of Ravengard, who she saw enthralled to the Absolute.
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer.how_to_trigger: Approach Florrick's cell in Wyrm Rock Prison:goto 52; 8; -694

EntranceGuard.synopsis: Dialog with the guard sleeping at the entrance door to the prison.
EntranceGuard.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 3 (WYR) - Wyrm Rock - PrisonMove forward and click on the guard sleeping on a stool.

TalkingSkull.synopsis: Dialog with the Talking Skull in Wyrm Rock Prison.Belongs to a necromancer who died in this cell.He used a spell to bind his soul to his skull.Only interested in talking to prisoners, really.
TalkingSkull.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_AReCon: oe wyr_imprisonWait for the talking skull to play an ADClick on the talking skull

Prisoner.synopsis: Dialog with a prisoner in Wyrm Rock Prison.Old man, doesn't want to get out - here he has a place to sleep and food & water.

Guard_003_AfterCarousing.synopsis: One-liner dialog for one of the Flaming Fist prison guards in the Wyrm's Rock prison that is played when the player wakes up inside the prison cell after drinking Sharess Caress' special drink. The guard talks through the bars accusing the player of carousing heavily.
Guard_003_AfterCarousing.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_ATODO: oe command* Goto Sharess Caress in Wyrms' Crossing, talk to the Bartender. Agree to drink Potent Drink.* Drink Potent brew and drink any other alchohol at the same time.* Repeat a few times.

Guard_001.synopsis: Dialog with a prison guard in Wyrm Rock Fortress. Male human prison guard has no time for your questions. And even if he did, he'd have no interest.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress.synopsis: Florrick's dialog when you helped her leave the fortress.
FlorrickOutisdeFortress.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_Agoto 47; 8; -696oe wyr_florrick_unlockTalk with Florrick. Make her join you.oe debugbookGo to Region - Act 3 - Wyrm's Crossing - Startclose debug book and talk to Florrick.

Trespassing.synopsis: Dialog when the guards spot you after you entered the prison without being allowed by the entrance guard.

NGB_PrisonEscapeAttack.synopsis: A Prison Guard attacking the player for a Prison Escape
NGB_PrisonEscapeAttack.how_to_trigger: oe wyr_imprisonwait 12 secondsclick on the skullrefuse to playclick on the skull again tell him to teleport you out

Guard_004_0.speaker: Fist Jagic
Guard_004_0.text: Watch your step. Just  because Lord Gortash is dead doesn't mean you can get away with anything.

Guard_004_1.speaker: Fist Jagic
Guard_004_1.text: Stay on my good side, yeah?

TalkingSkull_AD_0.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_AD_0.text: Mine voluble oratory falleth on insouciant ears.

TalkingSkull_AD_1.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_AD_1.text: Doth thee intend to just standeth thither?

TalkingSkull_AD_2.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_AD_2.text: Deafening silence. Did win't thee speaketh?

TalkingSkull_AD_3.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_AD_3.text: Speak thou or be silent. I careth myself not either way.

AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_4.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_4.text: Well - in you go. And don't feed the prisoners. Makes 'em cocky.

AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_1.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_1.text: Well - in you go. And don't feed the prisoners. Makes 'em cocky.

AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_2.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_2.text: What the hells happened to the door?

AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_3.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
AD_EntranceGuardAtDoor_3.text: Well go on inside. Ugh, what a mess.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_4.context: InternalNodeContext: The player told Florrick to wait,

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_0.speaker: Player
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_0.text: Let's get you out of here.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_2.speaker: Player
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_2.text: Not yet. Wait here a bit longer.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_7.text: Keep focused. We can talk once I'm free.
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Florrick is following the player.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_5.speaker: Player
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_5.text: Very well. Let's get you to safety.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_9.speaker: Player
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_9.text: Wait here. I'll fetch you when I can.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_6.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_6.text: Fine - but be quick. There are no safe corners in this fortress.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_8.text: Now's not the time for wandering. You can explore once I'm out of Wyrm's Rock.
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_8.context: InternalNodeContext: The player tried to use a forbidden exit (door to the Audience Hall or Wyrm Way Dungeon). Florrick doesn't want to go.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_1.speaker: Player
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_1.text: Agreed. Let's get you to safety.

FlorrickEscapeInProgress_10.speaker: Player
FlorrickEscapeInProgress_10.text: Wait here. I'll fetch you when I can.

Florrick_4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

Florrick_21.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick turns her head to the player. Absolutely demoralised.

Florrick_161.speaker: Wyll
Florrick_161.context: NodeContext: Sees his ally imprisoned and on her last legs

Florrick_118.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_118.text: Wyll? Is that you? What curse has befallen you?

Florrick_85.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_85.text: No matter. The city, the future. It's done.

Florrick_151.speaker: Player
Florrick_151.text: I don't understand. What do you mean?

Florrick_116.speaker: Player
Florrick_116.text: You're talking drivel. I'm getting you out of here.

Florrick_129.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_129.text: You don't get it. We lost.

Florrick_80.speaker: Player
Florrick_80.text: So you're giving up, just like that?

Florrick_33.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_33.text: I didn't give up. I lost.

Florrick_110.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_110.text: I came seeking allies to our cause. Watchers spotted me, dragged me to Ulder Ravengard's husk.

Florrick_130.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_130.text: Empty as a stare. Your father's a tadpole's puppet, Wyll. Nothing more.

Florrick_7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_7.text: Empty as a stare. A tadpole's puppet, nothing more.

Florrick_157.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_157.text: He spoke in accusations. Apostasy, conspiracy, sedition.

Florrick_102.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_102.text: I'll be executed in five dawns.

Florrick_43.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_43.text: I will soon be hanged on the city gallows to a chorus of cheers.

Florrick_154.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_154.text: You might have unlocked my cell, but there's no escape from this place.

Florrick_150.speaker: Wyll
Florrick_150.text: The Hells with that. Nothing is over. Not while I still draw breath.

Florrick_94.speaker: Player
Florrick_94.text: Ravengard's in a safe place, Florrick. All is not lost.

Florrick_153.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_153.text: Then - then there is hope yet. To think I'd all but given up.

Florrick_124.speaker: Player
Florrick_124.text: Ravengard's in a safe place, Florrick. All is not lost.

Florrick_74.speaker: Player
Florrick_74.text: Ravengard's dead. The city needs you - I'm getting you out.

Florrick_123.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_123.text: He's - dead? I prepared myself for this. Thought I was ready. But the sting still pierces deep.

Florrick_57.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_57.text: He - he once told me, 'When the people call for a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.'

Florrick_117.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_117.text: He was right. No more waiting, no more sulking. I know what to do.
Florrick_117.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

Florrick_11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_11.text: He's - dead? So perishes the city. I can - I can scarcely bear it.

Florrick_109.speaker: Player
Florrick_109.text: I'm breaking you out. With Ravengard gone, Baldur's Gate needs you.

Florrick_95.speaker: Player
Florrick_95.text: I'm breaking you out. Baldur's Gate needs you. Ravengard needs you.

Florrick_89.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_89.text: Forget it. Baldur's Gate's good as cinder. An illithid hive beyond saving.

Florrick_52.speaker: Narrator
Florrick_52.text: *You recall the tales of Gorion's Ward, the great hero of Baldur's Gate. Without them, the city would have succumbed to war, famine, and worse.*

Florrick_72.speaker: Player
Florrick_72.text: Gorion's Ward overcame great odds to protect the city. You can do the same.

Florrick_98.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_98.text: 'When the people need a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.'

Florrick_156.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_156.text: Indeed. To think I'd almost forgotten.

Florrick_114.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_114.text: No more sulking. I know what to do. And I can only do it with the help of the Blade.

Florrick_88.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_88.text: 'When the people need a miracle, you cannot wait for the gods to answer.' Ulder's words. I'd almost forgotten.

Florrick_25.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_25.text: No more sulking. I know what to do.
Florrick_25.context: NodeContext: Florrick sighs, revinigorated, and speaks her line.

Florrick_145.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_145.text: Unlock my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.

Florrick_54.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_54.text: Lead me from my cell, escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.

Florrick_23.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_23.text: I'll seek out my connections. When the city's streets shatter, you'll want their blades.

Florrick_152.speaker: Player
Florrick_152.text: Agreed. I'll find a way to unlock your cell.

Florrick_81.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_81.text: Damn you. Just as despair turned to hope.

Florrick_173.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_173.text: But - please. If what you said is true, Ravengard's not lost to us. Not yet.

Florrick_162.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_162.text: If you do battle, bind him. Knock him out. But spare him the blade.

Florrick_163.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_163.text: There's more to your story, Wyll - and it's your father who needs to tell it.

Florrick_51.speaker: Wyll
Florrick_51.text: Let's say I succeed, free his mind. Then what?

Florrick_10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_10.text: Then he'll point the way forward. There's more to your story, Wyll - and your father needs to tell it.

Florrick_196.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_196.text: He is the life and light of Baldur's Gate. You deserve him. And he deserves his son.

Florrick_19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_19.text: He is the life and light of Baldur's Gate. We deserve him. He deserves us.

Florrick_191.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_191.text: Hells - is it true? I can't believe it. We've lost so much.

Florrick_65.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_65.text: Then our hopes rest with you. May you find the will to keep the city safe.

Florrick_1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_1.text: - and it rests wholly with you. I trust you'll be the beacon to which we all can rally.

Florrick_193.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_193.text: The seasons change. So do minds. May yours find a way.
Florrick_193.context: NodeContext: Said with a big sigh

Florrick_107.speaker: Player
Florrick_107.text: I pull you from flames, and this is how you repay me? Find your courage and fight!

Florrick_136.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_136.text: What courage? I've bled my veins dry, cried my last tear.

Florrick_17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_17.text: I'm sorry, Wyll. I've got nothing more to give.

Florrick_166.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_166.text: I'm sorry. But there's no more I can give.

Florrick_103.speaker: Player
Florrick_103.text: Coward. Balduran didn't build the Gate for you to weep as it burns.

Florrick_56.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_56.text: I am already called traitor. Call me coward, call me craven. I am forfeit already.

Florrick_71.speaker: Player
Florrick_71.text: Fine, turn your back. I don't need you.

Florrick_115.speaker: Jaheira
Florrick_115.text: Are we so flush with friends that you would just cast one aside? If we are to win, we need her.
Florrick_115.context: NodeContext: Blunt, pragmatic - calling us on our bullshit

Florrick_83.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_83.text: We are all lost, gods have mercy.

Florrick_28.speaker: Player
Florrick_28.text: You said you wouldn't give up. I'm setting you free and holding you to it.

Florrick_62.speaker: Player
Florrick_62.text: Pathetic. I'm getting you out so I can beat some sense into you.

Florrick_78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_78.text: Heh - I'll give you credit. I'm drowning in tears, and you hold out a fist. Ulder would've done the same.

Florrick_69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_69.text: 'When the people need a miracle', he said, 'you cannot wait for the gods to answer.' I'd almost forgotten.

Florrick_29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_29.text: Then beat me. Take my head, leave me rotting. Death is already my fate.

Florrick_36.speaker: Player
Florrick_36.text: Ravengard's not lost. I felt him reach out to me.

Florrick_127.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_127.text: You - you felt him? Extraordinary. Maybe what is lost... can be found.

Florrick_104.speaker: Player
Florrick_104.text: I found your duke. I expect my reward.

Florrick_53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_53.text: What reward? I am empty. Ravengard is tadpoled, beyond rescue. There is nothing to give.

Florrick_67.speaker: Player
Florrick_67.text: I found your duke. He's dead, I'm sorry to say.

Florrick_41.speaker: Player
Florrick_41.text: Is that so? Well - good luck with that.

Florrick_119.speaker: Wyll
Florrick_119.text: Father is safe, Florrick. He is freed from the grip of the Absolute.

Florrick_35.speaker: Jaheira
Florrick_35.text: The Fist can go hang themselves - we're getting you out.

Florrick_49.speaker: Player
Florrick_49.text: Oh, don't be dramatic. I could unlock this cell blindfolded - you'll be out in no time.

Florrick_176.speaker: Player
Florrick_176.text: Calm down, this cell was trivial to unlock. Getting out of here will be easy.

Florrick_188.speaker: Jaheira
Florrick_188.text: Florrick? What have they done to you?
Florrick_188.context: NodeContext: Concern and trepidation - you're seeing an ally in a cell, and know the answer you're about to hear won't be good.

Florrick_169.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_169.text: I don't speak of myself, High Harper. I speak of the city itself - we came too late. It's over.

Florrick_45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_45.text: Ravengard is lost. I am lost.

Florrick_50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_50.text: Wyll? What has become of you?
Florrick_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

Florrick_93.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_93.text: You might as well lock the cell. You're too late.
Florrick_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

Florrick_99.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_99.text: Ravengard is lost. I am lost.

Florrick_120.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_120.text: Jaheira? You're too late, High Harper.

Florrick_122.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_122.text: You might as well lock the cell. You're too late.
Florrick_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.

Florrick_125.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_125.text: Tell me you bring good news.

Florrick_26.speaker: Player
Florrick_26.text: Follow me. I'll lead you to safety.

Florrick_111.speaker: Player
Florrick_111.text: Remind me what I should do.

Florrick_8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_8.text: Unlock this cell and escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.

Florrick_140.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_140.text: Then I can head to the city and gather allies.

Florrick_168.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_168.text: Escort me out of Wyrm's Rock.

Florrick_171.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_171.text: The city's future lies with us, then. We cannot rest until it is free from the Absolute's grip.

Florrick_185.speaker: Player
Florrick_185.text: I bring good news - Ravengard's safe.

Florrick_58.speaker: Player
Florrick_58.text: I bring good news - Ravengard's safe.

Florrick_13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_13.text: Truly? What fortune - then he might still be loosed from the Absolute's grasp!

Florrick_0.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_0.text: You must get me free. My allies will want to hear the good news.

Florrick_133.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_133.text: Jaheira? You're too late, High Harper.

Florrick_149.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_149.text: Leave me to rot. But don't abandon our city.

Florrick_143.speaker: Player
Florrick_143.text: I've changed my mind. I'll help you get to Baldur's Gate.

Florrick_3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_3.text: I knew you would see light.

Florrick_96.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_96.text: Please, free from this cell and lead me out of this prison.

Florrick_60.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_60.text: I will gather allies. They will be invaluable in the fight to come.

Florrick_137.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_137.text: Now you've unlocked the door, you can lead me from the prison.

Florrick_175.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_175.text: Wyll? What has become of you?
Florrick_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

Florrick_178.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_178.text: Leave me to rot. But don't abandon our city.

Florrick_181.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_181.text: Good - the cell's open. One step closer.

Florrick_183.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_183.text: Good - the cell's open. One step closer.

Florrick_184.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick looks away from player.InternalNodeContext: Player inside the cell

Florrick_187.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
Florrick_187.text: Tell me you bring good news.

Guard_003_0.speaker: Fist Ivarus
Guard_003_0.text: Lord Gortash is dead and life has no more meaning, so I don't care what you do. Just don't do it in front of me.

Guard_003_1.speaker: Fist Ivarus
Guard_003_1.text: Carry on. My duty is to my Lord.

Guard_003_2.speaker: Fist Ivarus
Guard_003_2.text: On your way. May Lord Gortash provide.

AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_0.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_0.context: NodeContext: Whispering to herself. She thinks it's too late to win.

AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_1.context: NodeContext: Whispering to herself. She thinks it's too late to win.

AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_2.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_2.text: I could have stopped it. I could have saved him.
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_2.context: NodeContext: Whispering to herself. She thinks it's too late to win.

AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_3.text: It's over. He's too far gone.
AD_FlorrickSpottedPlayer_3.context: NodeContext: Whispering to herself. She thinks it's too late to win.

EntranceGuard_49.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_49.text: (...bathed in a tenday... ate all the onions...)
EntranceGuard_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Talking in her sleep, eyes closed

EntranceGuard_7.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_7.text: Er - what now? Goodness, how embarrassing. I had a... heavy lunch.

EntranceGuard_42.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_42.text: Welcome to Wyrm's Rock Prison - the Fist nail, we jail. What's your business?

EntranceGuard_15.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_15.text: You let me through, and I won't tell the manip of your lunchtime tipples.

EntranceGuard_56.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_56.text: Well. Who am I to argue?

EntranceGuard_5.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_5.text: I'm here to see Old Man Otto. He's my father.

EntranceGuard_48.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_48.text: Your father? Hmph. Not much of a family resemblance. Well -

EntranceGuard_6.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_6.text: Second cell on the right. And you tell him no seconds for supper. This here's a prison, not an inn.

EntranceGuard_20.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_20.text: Hang on. I'll let you through.

EntranceGuard_9.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_9.text: Hang on, I'll - Aw, what the hells?

EntranceGuard_50.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_50.text: Damn key's taken a walk. Looks like no one's getting in. Not 'til the next shift.

EntranceGuard_39.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_39.text: Double hells - I'm the next shift!

EntranceGuard_3.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_3.text: I need to lay off the hooch. The manip finds out, she'll kick me clear to Neverwinter.

EntranceGuard_53.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_53.text: You're playing with my head? I won't stand for it!

EntranceGuard_33.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_33.text: Duke Ravengard has sent me to interrogate Florrick.

EntranceGuard_19.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_19.text: Last cell on the left. And give that traitor a what-for. She'll know what for.

EntranceGuard_44.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_44.text: The traitor? No visitors - Ravengard's orders. You understand.

EntranceGuard_38.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_38.text: I'm here for Arfur. It's time he answered my questions.

EntranceGuard_43.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_43.text: Aren't you the one who exposed the bloody bastard? Access godsdamned granted.

EntranceGuard_12.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_12.text: The toymaker? Sorry - no can do. High-risk prisoner, no guests allowed.

EntranceGuard_18.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_18.text: Prison inspection. Open the door and pray I don't find more sleeping guards.

EntranceGuard_22.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_22.text: Ah, well - that was a, erm, most unusual, um, circumstances being what they are... ahem.
EntranceGuard_22.context: NodeContext: Hemming and hawing trying to make excuses and coming up short.

EntranceGuard_55.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_55.text: Inspection? Not had one of those for nigh on a decade. I should know - I'm the inspector.

EntranceGuard_21.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_21.text: I don't have business here. I'm just exploring.

EntranceGuard_32.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_32.text: Then explore your way out of my personal space. No business, no entry.

EntranceGuard_13.speaker: Player
EntranceGuard_13.text: Listen closely to the guard's babbling.

EntranceGuard_4.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_4.text: (...Old Man Otto... back here again... cell stinks like an old cabbage... three bowls of the stew...)
EntranceGuard_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Talking in her sleep, eyes closed

EntranceGuard_26.speaker: Narrator
EntranceGuard_26.text: *You find no meaning in her mutterings.*

EntranceGuard_17.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_17.text: No crazing or criming down there. We run a tight ship.

EntranceGuard_25.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_25.text: Who takes a damn key? Dirty thieves, that's who.

EntranceGuard_31.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_31.text: Someone's turned the door to splinters. Just like my bones if the manip hears of this.

EntranceGuard_47.speaker: Breva Brightmoon
EntranceGuard_47.text: No one out, no one in. Well, some in. But not you.

TalkingSkull_0.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_0.text: 'Tis a most curious mind yond enters a prison cell of its own will.

TalkingSkull_102.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_102.text: Alas, I speak only to the caged who cannot leave of their own accord.

TalkingSkull_84.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_84.text: Shouldst thee perform illicit acts, we wilt have much to break with.

TalkingSkull_31.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_31.text: Solve two riddles for me. A right answer, and I teleport you to safety. A wrong answer, and I teleport you to the guards.

TalkingSkull_33.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_33.text: Thou hast returned? Mine own disappointment knows not its bounds.

TalkingSkull_85.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_85.text: To the guards, as was mine promise. Begone!

TalkingSkull_60.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_60.text: To the guards, as I promised. Begone!

TalkingSkull_34.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_34.text: Answer two riddles. Be true, and I teleport thee to safety. Be false, and I teleport thee to the guards.

TalkingSkull_39.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_39.text: Thou didst answereth so wise. Tis doneth.

TalkingSkull_14.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_14.text: You answered me wisely. Off with you, then.

TalkingSkull_41.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_41.text: We shall speaketh at the most promising hour, but never ere.

TalkingSkull_58.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_58.text: Must thy gaze pierce so deeply? Quite crude.

TalkingSkull_82.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_82.text: How malapert. Must thou stareth so?
TalkingSkull_82.context: NodeContext: All of the weird old ENglish is incorrect on purpose and should be spoken with great confidence

TalkingSkull_1.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_1.text: Nay sir hides within me. I am merely a skull, nay more and nay less.

TalkingSkull_88.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_88.text: I call myself Marvin. Thou mayst do the same.

TalkingSkull_70.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_70.text: Unfortunate, nay, ineluctable, perchance evitable, to be confined in such immuring quarters.

TalkingSkull_45.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_45.text: Thou wisheth to escape the confines of this prison, doth thou not? I can holpest thee for the cost of two riddles.

TalkingSkull_19.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_19.text: Answer me true, and I shall telep'rt thee to safety. Answer me false, and I shall telep'rt thee near the guards.

TalkingSkull_40.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_40.text: I fly, yet not through the firmament. I bidst and biddeth and bidstseth farewell at night and welcome thee in the morn. I am part of thee, and follow whither thou guideth.

TalkingSkull_62.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_62.text: I am clothened and claddened all in black, and flee the light. Yet apart 't, I wouldst be nought. Name me.

TalkingSkull_53.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_53.text: Poorly chosen, mine cousin. The correct answer was 'a shadow'.

TalkingSkull_9.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_9.text: Thy freedom is yours - thy safety is not. Such was mine gage.

TalkingSkull_89.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_89.text: A shame - I thought you more clever. The true answer is 'a shadow'.

TalkingSkull_56.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_56.text: I promised to free you, and so I shall. But I did not promise your safety.

TalkingSkull_36.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_36.text: Marvellous deduction - a shadow, forsooth! And anon, riddle the second.

TalkingSkull_92.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_92.text: I am battered, but nev'r did bow. Mine coronet bears the blunt of endless blades, but I can nev'r move.

TalkingSkull_10.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_10.text: I nev'r did sweat, even when the summertide sun didst fully heateth mine brow. Name me.

TalkingSkull_95.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_95.text: An anvil, forsooth! Thou hast maketh me most fustian.

TalkingSkull_83.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_83.text: Is't thy will to forsake this decrepit cell?

TalkingSkull_44.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_44.text: Hence with thee, then. Savour thy freedom, for thou cannot claim 't still. Away!

TalkingSkull_57.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_57.text: Freedom is yours. Savour it, for there is no gift that cannot be reclaimed or ravaged. Away!

TalkingSkull_20.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_20.text: An anvil, indeed! You make me most proud.

TalkingSkull_96.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_96.text: It is time to depart. Are you ready?

TalkingSkull_30.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_30.text: Alas, thou speaketh nay sooth to me. 'An anvil' was the answer.

TalkingSkull_55.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_55.text: Yet thou didst answer once truly. I wilt teleporteth thee into peril - but not without reguerdon.

TalkingSkull_90.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_90.text: Alas, what tragedy. 'An anvil' was the answer.

TalkingSkull_2.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_2.text: Your first answer was correct, nonetheless. I will send you to the guards - but you will not go unrewarded.

TalkingSkull_66.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_66.text: I am done answering these silly riddles. Just free me already.

TalkingSkull_8.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_8.text: Then begone with thee, and tradeth thy japes elsewhere!

TalkingSkull_91.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_91.text: Very good - your freedom is nigh. And now, the second riddle.

TalkingSkull_100.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_100.text: I am beaten and battered, but never break. My crown has felt the strike of endless blades, yet I can never move.

TalkingSkull_74.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_74.text: I never sweat, even when the summertide sun shines upon me. Who am I?

TalkingSkull_49.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_49.text: This is ridiculous. Just get me out of here.

TalkingSkull_73.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_73.text: I fly, but not through the sky. I say goodbye at night and hello in the morning. I am part of you, and follow wherever you go.

TalkingSkull_13.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_13.text: I wear only black, and run from the light. Yet without it, I couldn't exist. Who am I?

TalkingSkull_86.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_86.text: What a strange game you're playing. Who put you up to this?

TalkingSkull_32.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_32.text: The blame and the pleasure belong solely to me. A fine wizard I was, and a fine jester too, imprisoned for one night after a delightful rash of debauchery.

TalkingSkull_12.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_12.text: The spirit of a prankster had always dwelled in me. The game laid before you is born of jest, wizardry - and whiskey.

TalkingSkull_27.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_27.text: Such is mine own will. Once I did occupy this very prison after a night of most bacchanalian debauchery.

TalkingSkull_76.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_76.text: I possessed the spirit of a gleeker and the art of a wizard.

TalkingSkull_79.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_79.text: The merriment laid before thee is born of trifling jest, wizardry - and whiskey.

TalkingSkull_6.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_6.text: You talk like a drunk poet. If you wish to converse, you need to speak plainly.

TalkingSkull_38.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_38.text: *Sigh.* Common is just so very - common.

TalkingSkull_75.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_75.text: Very well. To rephrase: I will teleport you away for the cost of two riddles.

TalkingSkull_18.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_18.text: Answer them right, and I send you to safety. Answer them wrong, and I send you to the guards.

TalkingSkull_98.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_98.text: Mine own words are already as kersey as the travelling lamp in the summer sky.

TalkingSkull_7.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_7.text: Examine the skull. What magic is at work?

TalkingSkull_77.speaker: Narrator
TalkingSkull_77.text: *The enchantment is clearly the work of an advanced caster. The body may have wasted away, but the mind that inhabited it is imprinted on the skull.*

TalkingSkull_23.speaker: Narrator
TalkingSkull_23.text: *You can't fathom how this skull could be made to talk.*

TalkingSkull_42.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_42.text: I'm not playing this game with you.

TalkingSkull_26.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_26.text: I say thou art malapert to stare. But peradventure thou art new to such custom.

TalkingSkull_4.speaker: Player
TalkingSkull_4.text: A talking skull? I must be losing my mind.

TalkingSkull_61.speaker: Unusual Skull
TalkingSkull_61.text: Nay, thy mind hath not betrayed thee. I am as thou perceiveth.

Prisoner_3.speaker: Player
Prisoner_3.text: Not your attitude, that's for certain.

Prisoner_7.speaker: Otto Ott
Prisoner_7.text: You're the one pestering old men in cages. Now scram with your sour puss - you're disturbing my sitting time.

Prisoner_1.speaker: Player
Prisoner_1.text: To help you escape, if I can.

Prisoner_6.speaker: Otto Ott
Prisoner_6.text: I don't need to escape. I've got food, water, privacy. And I mean to keep it that way.

Prisoner_2.speaker: Otto Ott
Prisoner_2.text: For Balduran's sake, leave an old man in peace!

Prisoner_4.speaker: Otto Ott
Prisoner_4.text: For Balduran's sake, leave an old man in peace!

Prisoner_5.speaker: Player
Prisoner_5.text: Divinely pathetic. A louse fated to suffer.

Guard_003_AfterCarousing_1.speaker: Fist Ivarus
Guard_003_AfterCarousing_1.text: Well look who's finally up. Heard you had a taste of Hoots' newest hooch.

Guard_003_AfterCarousing_0.speaker: Fist Ivarus
Guard_003_AfterCarousing_0.text: Bet you don't even remember half the foolery you got up to. Well, make yourself at home - you'll be staying a while.

Guard_001_1.speaker: Fist Saunder
Guard_001_1.text: Questions? Talk to someone else. Comments? Same deal.

AD_PrisonGuards_9.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_9.text: Hells if I know. I've been stuck down here for what seems like a tenday.

AD_PrisonGuards_16.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_16.text: The sooner the better. If anyone can fix up this pigpen, it's him.

AD_PrisonGuards_24.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_24.text: We've already got the Council. What can Gortash do that they can't?

AD_PrisonGuards_11.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_11.text: Make a godsdamn decision, for starters. The Council talks 'til their jaws near fall off, but nothing ever gets done.

AD_PrisonGuards_8.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_8.text: Gortash? He's a man of action.

AD_PrisonGuards_7.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_7.text: My old bracers went missing - the ones Oloril sold me.
AD_PrisonGuards_7.context: InternalNodeContext: Here the guards are mentioning that things are getting stollen inside the fortress. That's a reference to the Flaming Fist Thief in the barracks.NodeContext: oh-LORE-ill

AD_PrisonGuards_22.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_22.text: There's a thieving rat in the barracks, I'm telling you. Unless you think my good helm grew legs and walked off.

AD_PrisonGuards_20.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_20.text: Don't be daft. You probably left 'em at Sharess' Caress after a slug of Hoots' latest hooch.

AD_PrisonGuards_1.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_1.text: Might be right. One sip and the world goes all fuzzy, like I'm dreaming - but awake.

AD_PrisonGuards_30.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_30.text: That's some godsdamned poetry right there.

AD_PrisonGuards_13.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_13.text: What's the plan with the Grand Duke's counsellor?

AD_PrisonGuards_4.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_4.text: Sentenced to hang, last I knew.

AD_PrisonGuards_2.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_2.text: Hells. Gortash isn't pulling his punches.

AD_PrisonGuards_10.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_10.text: Why should he? She's a blasted traitor, no two ways about it. One of those Absolute cultists.

AD_PrisonGuards_26.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_26.text: Never saw it coming. Loyal to the city 'til the end, I figured.

AD_PrisonGuards_0.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_0.text: It's always the ones you least suspect.

AD_PrisonGuards_14.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_14.text: Hear the news out of the foundry?

AD_PrisonGuards_18.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_18.text: What? Toobin finally get crushed by a Watcher?

AD_PrisonGuards_25.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_25.text: Nah - heard they're making those metal beasts with four legs now 'stead of two.

AD_PrisonGuards_12.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_12.text: Damn. Two more legs for smashing? Would love to see that thing in action.

AD_PrisonGuards_21.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_21.text: Old Man Otto's been muttering in his sleep. Something about a dragon sleeping under Wyrm's Rock.

AD_PrisonGuards_28.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_28.text: It's all that gruel he's been getting. He's hungrier than a farm ox after ploughing.

AD_PrisonGuards_23.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_23.text: Doesn't he have family who could look after him? The fellow's a few haystalks short of a stack.

AD_PrisonGuards_5.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_5.text: Had an uncle like that. Swore his outhouse was haunted.

AD_PrisonGuards_19.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_19.text: Turns out there was a ghost in there, for real. Local wizard had to get rid of it.

AD_PrisonGuards_15.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_15.text: So, what? You're saying there could really be a dragon down there?

AD_PrisonGuards_17.speaker: Fist Jagic
AD_PrisonGuards_17.text: Hells if I know. Just saying that sometimes there's nothing stranger than truth.

AD_PrisonGuards_27.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_27.text: You got any idea what we're supposed to do different what with Lord Gortash getting murdered?

AD_PrisonGuards_3.speaker: Fist Creekrider
AD_PrisonGuards_3.text: Not a clue. Just keep doing what we were doing, I guess.

AD_PrisonGuards_29.speaker: Fist Saunder
AD_PrisonGuards_29.text: I guess. With any luck, nobody upstairs will give us a thought for a full tenday. Maybe two.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_20.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_20.text: This is far enough - the way should be clear.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_4.text: I can't thank you enough. For getting me out of that damned prison. And for giving me courage when I'd all but run out.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_11.speaker: Wyll
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_11.text: It's the least we could do. Your faith in this city should inspire us all.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_3.text: A faith passed on by your father. He was ever loyal, even when the skies were darkest.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_6.speaker: Player
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_6.text: Your faith in this city is an inspiration.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_7.speaker: Player
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_7.text: It's the least I could do. You've proven a vital ally.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_1.text: We came through the shadows together. That's not an experience one forgets.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_12.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_12.text: I will travel to the Upper City, find what allies I can.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_13.text: You won't fight the coming battle alone. As long as the city stands, I will stand with it. This is my promise.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_8.text: When the flames roared loudest, you pulled me to safety. Most would have let me burn - I won't forget it.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_16.speaker: Player
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_16.text: I'm glad to see you free. You've proven a vital ally.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_27.speaker: Player
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_27.text: Inspiring folk is what I do. Perhaps you could do the same - we need allies.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_19.speaker: Player
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_19.text: Speaking of inspiring - perhaps you'd be able to muster some allies of your own?

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_25.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_25.text: Yes. I have some connections in the Upper City - perhaps they'll heed our call.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_18.speaker: Player
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_18.text: Good luck out there. You'll need it.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_10.text: Not-so-encouraging words. If we're to crush the Absolute, we need to hold our heads high, and our weapons higher.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_22.speaker: Jaheira
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_22.text: Don't be so quick with your gratitude, Counsellor. All we have done is send you back into the battle.
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_22.context: NodeContext: Wryly amused - yes, we saved an ally, but she's going to need to work for it now. She might wish we'd left her where she was.

FlorrickOutisdeFortress_24.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FlorrickOutisdeFortress_24.text: And reminded me why I fight it in the first place. Truly - thank you.

Trespassing_0.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_0.text: *A prison guard has spotted you. It's either lie - or fight.*

Trespassing_6.speaker: Player
Trespassing_6.text: I've been authorised to inspect the prison. Now stand aside.

Trespassing_2.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_2.text: *Somehow, the guard buys your excuse. You're free to roam Wyrm's Rock Prison.*

Trespassing_1.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing_1.text: *The guard sees through your deception. You'll have to battle your way out of this mess.*

NGB_PrisonEscapeAttack_0.speaker: Narrator
NGB_PrisonEscapeAttack_0.text: *The guard prepares to attack. Fugitives are to be killed on sight.*
